bibl.title: Despatch from Ezekiel E. Smith to William F. Wharton, April 29, 1890
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consular General

div1.p: Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, April 29th, 1890
Mer. Ezekiel E. Smith To the Deartment of State.
John S. Bowles, Co. D. 5 Ohio, vols. Santa Cruz, Bolivia
Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, April 29th 1890.
Honorable William F. Wharton, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington, D. C.
Sir: I have the honor respectfully to acknwoeldge the receipt of your Circular dispatch of March 11th, 1890, with reference to John S. Bowles of Santa Cruz.
I am, by said circular, directed "to designate a competent physician to examine John S. Bowles of Santa Cruz, an applicant for pension under Certificate No. 734543." as

As Santa Cruz, Bolivia, is quite a distance from this post, and as the instruction contianed in the said Circular directs me to incur no expense whatever in attending to the affair save the mdical examination fee; and as I am requested to give propt attention to the Commisioners request, I beg to return said pension papers of John S. Bowles and ask further instructions relative thereto.
I am, sir, your obedient servant,
Ezekiel E. Smith. U.S. Consul General
Inclosures: Pension Papers of John S. Bowles
